subject_terms_4: Southeast Asia (general region) India (nation)  Australia (nation) East Indies (general region)
creator_2: Nicolas Visscher I Pieter Schenk Jr
physical_appearance: This is a multicoloured map of Southeast Asia, created by Nicolas Visscher I and published by Pieter Schenk Jr. There are many words at the top of the map, highlighting the names of places in Southeast Asia where the Dutch East India Company (VOC) extended their control over trade activities. The bottom of the map has lines of text that represent the title and scale of the map.
sgcool_label_text: This map of Southeast Asia by Nicolas Visscher was printed in the early 18th century by Pieter Schenk. It depicts the sphere of influence of the Dutch East India Company, spanning from India to the northern coastline of Australia. The focus, however, is that of the East Indies around which the spice trade was centred.
title_text: Visscher's Map of Southeast Asia published by Pieter Schenk
subject_terms_2: Pictorial maps Coasts Cartography Nederlandsche Oost-Indische Compagnie East Indies Spice trade India Australia Southeast Asia Cartouches, Ornamental (Decorative arts)
techniques_name: papermaking copper engraving (printing process) hand coloring
scale_type: The scale of the map is in miles.
